data.title: Luke Ridnour to Grizzlies: Latest Trade Details, Comments, Reaction
data.meta_description: The Memphis Grizzlies reportedly acquired point guard  Luke Ridnour  from the Orlando Magic on Wednesday in exchange for Janis Timma, a second-round pick in the 2013  NBA  draft.     Adrian Wojnarowski  of Yahoo Sports broke the news...
data.text:
Reinhold Matay/Associated Press

The Memphis Grizzlies reportedly acquired point guard Luke Ridnour from the Orlando Magic on Wednesday in exchange for Janis Timma, a second-round pick in the 2013 NBA draft.

Adrian Wojnarowski of Yahoo Sports broke the news. Ridnour, 34, is heading into the final season of his contract and is scheduled to make $2.75 million, according to Spotrac.

He signed with Orlando last summer but was an extremely limited contributor for the Magic. He averaged just four points and two assists while playing a career-low 14.5 minutes per game.

With Beno Udrih already in the mix to back up Mike Conley, the timing of the acquisition will raise some eyebrows in Memphis. Geoff Calkins of the Commercial Appeal believes the wheeling and dealing may continue:

Timma was the final pick of the 2013 draft. The 22-year-old Latvian has continued to play in his home country with Ventspils and VEF Riga. It remains unclear when the swingman will make the NBA jump.

Real GM previously reported he was looking into a Euroleague move for next term, as Memphis wasn't planning to bring him over. Whether the outlook will change with Orlando is unclear. The Magic also save cap space in the meantime.

Ridnour can provide some veteran stability at the point for the Grizzlies. That said, the bigger story is that it appears Memphis might be setting itself up to make a more impactful move, potentially at this week's draft.
